sentence: Every member of the family is a vital cog in research.
sentence_gap: Every member of the family is a vital ___ in research.

explanation: threats used to force a person to do something
sentence: He claimed that he signed the confession under duress.
sentence_gap: He claimed that he signed the confession under ______.

explanation: to surround and cover something or someone completely
sentence: The flames rapidly engulfed the house.

explanation: formal; smelling extremely bad and stale
sentence: People languish in fetid prisons around the world; those people seek asylum and safety.
sentence_gap: People languish in _____ prisons around the world; those people seek asylum and safety.

sentence: It is a hereditary title, so Mark Howard will become Sir Mark Howard on his father's death.
sentence_gap: It is a __________ title, so Mark Howard will become Sir Mark Howard on his father's death.

explanation: an act of attacking someone and stealing their money
sentence: Police are concerned that mugging is on the increase.
sentence_gap: Police are concerned that _______ is on the increase.

explanation: (especially of a place) attractive in appearance, especially in an old-fashioned way
sentence: We strolled through the picturesque streets of the old city.
sentence_gap: We strolled through the ___________ streets of the old city.

explanation: behavior in which two people or groups of people give each other help and advantages
sentence: We offer to all our trading partners a commitment to reciprocity and fairness.
sentence_gap: We offer to all our trading partners a commitment to ___________ and fairness.

explanation: an official order that stops or delays the punishment, especially by death, of a prisoner
sentence: The injection provided a temporary reprieve from the pain.
sentence_gap: The injection provided a temporary ________ from the pain.

explanation: a fault or a failure to reach a particular standard
sentence: Whatever his shortcomings as a husband, he was a good father to his children.
sentence_gap: Whatever his ____________ as a husband, he was a good father to his children.

explanation: magazines, books, pictures, films or jokes that offend some people because they relate to sex
sentence: There's an awful lot of smut on television these days.
sentence_gap: There's an awful lot of ____ on television these days.

sentence: He was swayed by what he read
sentence_gap: He was ______ by what he read

explanation: using few words, sometimes in a way that seems rude or unfriendly
sentence: The President issued a terse statement denying the charges.
sentence_gap: The President issued a _____ statement denying the charges.

explanation: used to refer to very heavy rain
sentence: Torrential rain helped to disperse the large crowd, estimated at 150,000.
sentence_gap: __________ rain helped to disperse the large crowd, estimated at 150,000.

sentence: Langdale described the court ruling as a travesty of justice.
sentence_gap: Langdale described the court ruling as a ________ of justice.
